column4: can i dual boot windows 2000 (dell edition) with my already installed Ubuntu 7.10?
I tried it once and the windows 2000 installation failed
you'll have to partition beforehand in linux, using gparted
you mean with the gparted livecd?
you'll most likely have to use the livecd yes
after i partition, do i just install windows 2000 the normal way?
shrink your linux partition and format it to ntfs, and windows 2000 should recognize it and install
is there anyway to do it without deleting all my linux stuff?
and then you'll have to use the ubuntu livecd to rebuild grub, but that's fairly easy
yes, gparted will automatically do that for you, it shows you what you've used and you can just drag the space smaller
unless you've used up almost all your disk space
nope, i haven't used up the space. i still have about 50 gigabytes left
and that's more than enough for windows 2000. it's a pretty small installation
thanks for your advice, i'll try it again one of these days
yeah that'll be fine then, just boot into gparted, shrink your ext2 or ext3 or whatever you're using for ubuntu, and then format the blank space as ntfs
